item.title: Roland add a quote by Jack Vance
item.description: "I understand the gist of your speculation,' said Rhialto. 'It is most likely nuncupatory." -- Jack Vance

item.title: Roland add a quote by Jack Vance
item.description: "What are your fees?" inquired Guyal cautiously. "I respond to three questions," stated the augur. "For twenty terces I phrase the answer in clear and actionable language; for ten I use the language of cant, which occasionally admits of ambiguity; for five, I speak a parable which you must interpret as you will; and for one terce, I babble in an unknown tongue." -- Jack Vance

item.title: Roland add a quote by Heinrich Heine
item.description: "Where they have burned books, they will end in burning human beings." -- Heinrich Heine

item.title: Roland add a quote by Heinrich Heine
item.description:
"Das war ein Vorspiel nur; dort wo man BÃ¼cher verbrennt, verbrennt man auch am Ende Menschen."
<i>(Almansor)</i>" -- Heinrich Heine

item.title: Roland add a quote by Jean-Jacques Rousseau
item.description: "Man is born free, and everywhere he is in chains." -- Jean-Jacques Rousseau
